Html: I really like the Adventureworks 2008 database schema(s) over the Adventureworks 2005 version! I would like to incorporate the "Person" and "HumanResources" schemas (and the handling of entitie's PK using the BusinessEntity table ID) of the 2008 schema into a SQL Server 2005 Schema. 1.) Does anyone see a problem with using the 08 approach in 05 -Note: am not planning to use LINQ at this time, and 2.) I am a little confused about how to generate an auto generated BusinessEntityID in the BusinessEntity table (unless I add an insertable field - i.e., other than autogenerated or newid( ) or getdate( )) - therefore, is it necessary to add a field to this table in order to get an 'insert' action on this table or can one create an INSERT statement without any values - in order to get the 'auto generated' pk to populate?

We're glad you like the new design. We hope to ship the Entity Framework samples that it was redesigned for someday soon.

There's no reason that you couldn't retrofit the design into the SQL Server 2005 version. I don't recall any new data types on that table.

There's a DEFAULT on the [rowguid] and [ModifiedDate] columns that specify newid() and getdate() respectively. If you specify the column list and omit them, their values will be created automatically.
